summary: How I want Game of Thrones to end:
body:
How I want Game of Thrones to end:

  • Jaime kissing Brienne like his damn life depends on it
  • Brienne tells Jaime that he better effing survive the final battle because she needs to have words with him
  • And he does (because Jaime loves her, wants to marry, and wants to be a damn good father to her children)
  • Bronn gets a castle, a wife, and a shit-ton of gold for how often he’s supported and saved the Lannister brothers
  • Pod gets made a knight, but casually decides to stay in the North to support Sansa (because he knows she’s a damn good leader and he *might* have a crush on both her and Arya)
  • Gendry winds up in Winterfell and Arya cannot deal with the fact that he’s still really hot
  • Sansa *knows* that Arya really likes Gendry and she tries to give her sister advice on the fact
  • Sam gets all the nice things
  • Gilly continues her education and she winds up become the unofficial maester of the North/Winterfell/the Night’s Watch through a combination of stubbornness, self-taught knowledge, and practical experience
  • Sansa, Arya, Brienne, and Lyanna Mormont meet Gilly and decide, “Her! We must support her! She is of the North! And she will survive!”
  • Jon and Daenerys both get squicked out when they find out they’re related and they don’t ever boink again
  • Lyanna Mormont bear-glares Jorah Mormont after she calls him out for his shady behavior (like having zero regrets for being a slaver and for being pissed off after because the woman he’s lusting after is less than half his age and has friend-zoned him)
  • Yara (Asha) survives and flirts with all the ladies
  • Theon gets to take a damn nap and eat a proper meal for once
  • Eddison Tollet and Bronn compare notes about their ships
  • (Pod has to mediate)
  • Sansa and Tyrion unite, realize just how much they have in common, decide that they work well together, and wind up getting married (again)
  • Sansa winds up as Warden of the North/unofficial Queen in the North
  • Tyrion is her Hand (he resigns as Daenerys’ Hand because (a) he’s married to Sansa, (b) there is no way in any circle of hell he’d be anyone else’s Hand, if given the option, and © he can’t stop talking about how awesome and beautiful Sansa is and EVERYONE just wants him to be with her so that he’ll just shut up already)
  • Everyone hugs Davos and thanks him for everything he’s done
  • Davos gets to retire in peace (and quiet, thank you very much!)

summary: Sansa Stark, Season 2 Don’t be afraid. The queen has raised the drawbridge. This is the safest place we can be. Joffrey’s not...
caption:
Sansa Stark, Season 2

Don’t be afraid. The queen has raised the drawbridge. This is the safest place we can be. Joffrey’s not hurt, he’s fighting bravely. His knights have rallied behind him. They will save the city. Shall we sing a hymn?

blog.name: maisiestyle
blog.title: Maisie Williams | Arya Stark | Styles & Musings

summary: The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen...
caption:
The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen Alysanne.

Arya says she want to build castles. Queen Alysanne did that too. She was also an unconventional Lady, broke the mold and was a free-spirit with a fondness for the North.

Thanks to G-Girl95 for pointing this out from George’s new book Fire and Blood, we get this cute quote that mirrors Alysanne and Arya so sweetly:

Arya sipped at her tankard cautiously, between spoonfuls of pie still warm from the oven. Her father sometimes let them have a cup of beer, she remembered. Sansa used to make a face at the taste and say that wine was ever so much finer, but Arya had liked it well enough. It made her sad to think of Sansa and her father. (Arya II, ACoK)

And then about Alysanne:
Lord Manderly entertained the queen lavishly. At the welcoming feast an entire aurochs was roasted, and his lordship’s daughter Jessamyn acted as the queen’s cupbearer, filling her tankard with a strong northern ale that Her Grace pronounced finer than any wine she had ever tasted.
~*~

- Alysanne wasn’t raised with the expectation that she would be Queen. She had an older sister already married off several times in violent and political marriages.

- Alysanne was the youngest living daughter of King Aenys I Targaryen.

- Alysanne was 12 years old when her brother became king. Arya will turn 12 in Winds of Winter, when Jon becomes KiTN

It’s just so interesting looking back on what Arya told her Father about her future.

“Can I be a King’s Councillor and build castles and become the High Septon?”

Ned tells her she will marry a King and rule his Castle, and will possibly have a child that may become the High Septon.


The above Arya quote is key and strongly relates to Queen Alysanne.

- Alysanne was a dragonrider who loved to fly. *Arya also expresses a desire to fly several times. She says she wants to turn into a wolf with wings

- Alysanne is a keen archer and hunter. Very “tomboy” and unlady-like activities. Arya has demonstrated all these traits. She has hunted and in the show is an expert archer.

- Queen Alysanne enjoyed physical activity (a quality that would have appealed to her brother Jaehaerys, who was reputed to be a fine dragonrider as well as a skilled archer and horseman). They spent many years growing up together before Jaehaerys became King.

- Alysanne married her brother Jaehaerys and became Queen. She was also the  King’s most trusted Counsellor. A role Arya says she wants in her future when Ned tells her she will marry a King.

- Alysanne was loved by the smallfolk. She lived amongst them even after becoming Queen.


“Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody.“

And:

Arya had loved nothing better than to sit at her farthers table and listen to them talk. She had loved listening to the men on the benches too; to freeriders tough as leather, courtly knights and bold young squires, and gizzeld old men at arms.”

Arya, even while being brainwashed by the FM, she is still a social butterfly. Still making friends where ever she went. It’s interesting she preferred Cat of the Canals of all of her disguises. Sidenote: In her backstory for Cat, Arya actually says that Cat arrived to Braavos on ship named Nymeria.


“She missed the friends she’d had when she was Cat of the Canals; Old Brusco with his bad back, his daughters Talea and Brea, the mummers from the Ship, Merry and her whores at the Happy Port, all the other rogues and wharfside scum. She missed Cat herself the most of all, even more than she missed her eyes. She had liked being Cat, more than she had ever liked being Salty or Squab or Weasel or Arry.”

Queen Alysanne planned and funded the building of a Castle called Deep Lake. She had Queensgate named in her honor. Arya wants to build Castles

Alysanne was a fierce believer in woman’s rights and actively changed societies standards. “Alysanne saw no reason why a man should be favored over a woman”. Which is something Arya strongly believes in and has even told Jon directly when Arya said a woman is equal to a man.
caption_abstract:
The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen Alysanne.

Arya says she want to build castles. Queen Alysanne did that too. She was also an unconventional Lady, broke the mold and was a free-spirit with a fondness for the North.

Thanks to G-Girl95 for pointing this out from George’s new book Fire and Blood, we get this cute quote that mirrors Alysanne and Arya so sweetly:

- Alysanne was loved by the smallfolk. She lived amongst them even after becoming Queen.


“Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody.“

And:

Arya had loved nothing better than to sit at her farthers table and listen to them talk. She had loved listening to the men on the benches too; to freeriders tough as leather, courtly knights and bold young squires, and gizzeld old men at arms.”

Arya, even while being brainwashed by the FM, she is still a social butterfly. Still making friends where ever she went. It’s interesting she preferred Cat of the Canals of all of her disguises. Sidenote: In her backstory for Cat, Arya actually says that Cat arrived to Braavos on ship named Nymeria.


“She missed the friends she’d had when she was Cat of the Canals; Old Brusco with his bad back, his daughters Talea and Brea, the mummers from the Ship, Merry and her whores at the Happy Port, all the other rogues and wharfside scum. She missed Cat herself the most of all, even more than she missed her eyes. She had liked being Cat, more than she had ever liked being Salty or Squab or Weasel or Arry.”

Queen Alysanne planned and funded the building of a Castle called Deep Lake. She had Queensgate named in her honor. Arya wants to build Castles

Alysanne was a fierce believer in woman’s rights and actively changed societies standards. “Alysanne saw no reason why a man should be favored over a woman”. Which is something Arya strongly believes in and has even told Jon directly when Arya said a woman is equal to a man.
trail.content:
The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen Alysanne.

Arya says she want to build castles. Queen Alysanne did that too. She was also an unconventional Lady, broke the mold and was a free-spirit with a fondness for the North.

Thanks to G-Girl95 for pointing this out from George’s new book Fire and Blood, we get this cute quote that mirrors Alysanne and Arya so sweetly:

Arya sipped at her tankard cautiously, between spoonfuls of pie still warm from the oven. Her father sometimes let them have a cup of beer, she remembered. Sansa used to make a face at the taste and say that wine was ever so much finer, but Arya had liked it well enough. It made her sad to think of Sansa and her father. (Arya II, ACoK)


And then about Alysanne:

Lord Manderly entertained the queen lavishly. At the welcoming feast an entire aurochs was roasted, and his lordship’s daughter Jessamyn acted as the queen’s cupbearer, filling her tankard with a strong northern ale that Her Grace pronounced finer than any wine she had ever tasted.

~*~

- Alysanne wasn’t raised with the expectation that she would be Queen. She had an older sister already married off several times in violent and political marriages.

- Alysanne was the youngest living daughter of King Aenys I Targaryen.

- Alysanne was 12 years old when her brother became king. Arya will turn 12 in Winds of Winter, when Jon becomes KiTN

It’s just so interesting looking back on what Arya told her Father about her future.

“Can I be a King’s Councillor and build castles and become the High Septon?”

Ned tells her she will marry a King and rule his Castle, and will possibly have a child that may become the High Septon.


The above Arya quote is key and strongly relates to Queen Alysanne.

- Alysanne was a dragonrider who loved to fly. *Arya also expresses a desire to fly several times. She says she wants to turn into a wolf with wings

- Alysanne is a keen archer and hunter. Very “tomboy” and unlady-like activities. Arya has demonstrated all these traits. She has hunted and in the show is an expert archer.

- Queen Alysanne enjoyed physical activity (a quality that would have appealed to her brother Jaehaerys, who was reputed to be a fine dragonrider as well as a skilled archer and horseman). They spent many years growing up together before Jaehaerys became King.

- Alysanne married her brother Jaehaerys and became Queen. She was also the  King’s most trusted Counsellor. A role Arya says she wants in her future when Ned tells her she will marry a King.

- Alysanne was loved by the smallfolk. She lived amongst them even after becoming Queen.


“Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody.“

And:

Arya had loved nothing better than to sit at her farthers table and listen to them talk. She had loved listening to the men on the benches too; to freeriders tough as leather, courtly knights and bold young squires, and gizzeld old men at arms.”

Arya, even while being brainwashed by the FM, she is still a social butterfly. Still making friends where ever she went. It’s interesting she preferred Cat of the Canals of all of her disguises. Sidenote: In her backstory for Cat, Arya actually says that Cat arrived to Braavos on ship named Nymeria.


“She missed the friends she’d had when she was Cat of the Canals; Old Brusco with his bad back, his daughters Talea and Brea, the mummers from the Ship, Merry and her whores at the Happy Port, all the other rogues and wharfside scum. She missed Cat herself the most of all, even more than she missed her eyes. She had liked being Cat, more than she had ever liked being Salty or Squab or Weasel or Arry.”

Queen Alysanne planned and funded the building of a Castle called Deep Lake. She had Queensgate named in her honor. Arya wants to build Castles

Alysanne was a fierce believer in woman’s rights and actively changed societies standards. “Alysanne saw no reason why a man should be favored over a woman”. Which is something Arya strongly believes in and has even told Jon directly when Arya said a woman is equal to a man.
trail.content_abstract:
The similarities to Good Queen Alysanne are rather plenty. I’m adding to this growing list with the newly released info on Queen Alysanne.

Arya says she want to build castles. Queen Alysanne did that too. She was also an unconventional Lady, broke the mold and was a free-spirit with a fondness for the North.

Thanks to G-Girl95 for pointing this out from George’s new book Fire and Blood, we get this cute quote that mirrors Alysanne and Arya so sweetly:

so i really i didn't know where to put it
i love her more than any other character
a song of ice and fire
summary: send me a character and i’ll list: Sansa Stark favorite thing about them: her unwavering kindness, compassion and empathy for...
body:
send me a character and i’ll list: Sansa Stark

  • favorite thing about them: her unwavering kindness, compassion and empathy for others despite everything that she went through. 
  • least favorite thing about them: her treatment of arya in the first book
  • favorite line: ‘‘My skin went from porcelain to ivory to steel.”
  • brOTP: SansaxBran (i want more of them together), Theonsa, Sanrya 
  • OTP: SansaxHarry
  • nOTP: SanSan,Sanryon, SansaxPetyr, SansaxMargaery, SansaxRamsey
  • random headcanon: Sansa and Bran used to be really close because they always listened to stories with each other and they would fangirl/fanboy together about all the stories/songs
  • unpopular opinion: Sansa was amazing from the beginning. 
  • song i associate with them: Runaway - AURORA
  • favorite picture of them:

blog.description: GOT memes, rambles, info & appreciation (for the cast/characters not D&D or the themes & narratives within the story lol)

body:
Is Littlefinger A Sociopath?

Signs Of A Sociopath:

Someone with Antisocial Personality Disorder, ocurring from the age of 15 and up. Must have at least 3 of the following:

  • Failure to conform to social norms with respect to lawful/moral behaviour.
  • Deceitfulness, as indicated by lying, use of aliases and conning others.
  • Impulsivity or failure to plan ahead.
  • Irritability and aggressiveness.
  • Reckless disregard for safety of themselves and others.
  • Consistent irresponsibility.
  • Lack of remorse, guilt, shame or emotion
  • Focus on winning the “game of life”.
  • Want control over others and power.
  • Can mimic emotion and behaviour so that they get what they want.
  • Untrustworthy and constantly lies.
  • Insantly likeable or charming.

Can you spot at least 3 that match Baelish?

The Evidence:

Oh, boy, is there a lot of evidence! Let’s begin. Well, the first one is rather obvious. Baelish runs brothels and has taken part in the murders of a Hand (Arryn) and a King (Joff). He doesn’t exactly exuberate lawful and moral behaviour, nor does he respect it.

His deceitfulness is as plain as day. Baelish is renowned for his lying and manipulation, and revels in it. It’s his own personal playground. This also ties into not being able to trust him. At all. This evidenced by his actions and even himself, with that rather iconic line…

“Distrusting me was the wisest thing you’ve done since you climbed off your horse.”

“Look around you, we’re all liars here, and every one of us is better than you.”

“Is there an idiot in any village who trusts Littlefinger?”

This third one was a little tricky and I had to do some searching. And as it turns out, Baelish isn’t great at planning things. For one, that fight with Brandon Stark - impulsive, brash and planned terribly. Then we have the entire plan to cause a rift between Lannisters and Starks by making a flimsy lie about Tyrion owning the Valyrian Steel dagger. In truth, the only reason his plans “worked” is because of some luck and a dash of deceit.

“So I challenged him to a duel. I mean, why not? I’d read all the stories. The little hero always beats the big villain in all the stories. In the end, she wouldn’t even let him kill me.”

“The first mistake was when he subtly made a jab at Cersei about her unnatural relationship with her brother Jaime, that knowledge is power, which resulted in Cersei nearly having him killed before deciding to remind him of his place.”

The fourth one does not apply to Baelish. He has not shown any aggressiveness.

This next one definitely applies to him. Baelish blatantly does not care about what happens to others and, arguably, doesn’t really have much regard for himself. He doesn’t care about the safety of Sansa when he marries her to Ramsay (show) or keeps her in the Vale. He doesn’t care about Lysa when he pushes her from the Moon Door. He doesn’t care, even, about Cat (he manipulates her without any issue).

“When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it.”

The next one also somewhat suits Baelish. Sociopaths don’t take claim for their wrongdoings and are only responsible in terms of how they deem “responsibility”. Baelish is more than eager to toss the blame of the dagger onto Tyrion in order to wage war between Stark and Lannister. He is more than eager to make everyone believe that Lysa jumped herself. So on and so forth.

I think it’s safe to say that Baelish does not feel any remorse, guilt or empathy. He doesn’t seem at all bothered when he throws Lysa or when has a child poisoned or when he marries Sansa to Ramsay (someone known for being cruel). He just doesn’t care and doesn’t feel bad about it.

“Littlefinger is willing to casually dispose of people who trusted him, like a man replacing a coat he no longer needs.”

We all know that Baelish has an obsession with winning “the game”. He wants power and he wants control. He acts as though everyone else is a chess piece in his game, using them to move spaces and get him ahead. He even says that, at one point…

“Are you a player or are you a piece?”

“Whenever I consider a question, I ask myself ‘Will this action make this picture a reality’, pull it out of my mind and into the world…and I only act if the answer is yes. A picture of me on the Iron Throne, and you by my side.”

“He would see this country burn if he could be king of the ashes.”

“Chaos isn’t a pit. Chaos is a ladder. Many who try to climb it fail, and never get to try again. The fall breaks them. And some are given a chance to climb, but refuse. They cling to the realm, or the gods, or love… illusions. Only the ladder is real. The climb is all there is.”

“Littlefinger was born with no lands, no wealth, no armies. He has acquired the first two. How long before he has the army? Perhaps you’ll laugh, but I know him better than most, and this is the truth. Littlefinger is one of the most dangerous men in Westeros.”

This next one is something I’m not entirely sure upon. Does he mimic behaviour and emotions? Possibly. We don’t see a whole lot of genuine emotion coming from him. The one time he shows some full-on “emotion”, is when he about to be executed. And even then, it feels somehow fake and artificial - he may have been crying and begging because that’s what he thought they wanted to see, and what he thought would get him out of the situation.

“He is capable of putting on a seemingly friendly face with a friendly smile - but his eyes don’t smile when his mouth does.”

And now… He’s considered a charming and likeable person, somewhat. Cat still trusts him and he uses that as an advantage to manipulate her - the woman he supposedly loves or loved, at least.

“Even Littlefinger’s alleged feelings for Catelyn Stark truly seem to have just been a rationalization for his greed for power. Though surely, Littlefinger himself is convinced that he truly "loved” her, in reality, his attraction was one-sided, and he was obsessively stalking a girl who never returned his affections beyond a platonic level.“

What Causes It?

  • Family history of the disorder.
  • Injuries to brain or abnormal brain development or how the brain functions
  • Childhood conduct disorder.
  • Trauma, abuse or neglect in childhood.
  • Low social or economic status as child.

Simply from this, I have some theories about why Baelish could be a Sociopath. We don’t know much about his childhood but we do know that he got into a fight with Brandon Stark - and almost died. He could have sustained a brain injury during that time. Besides that, it could have to do with his family and family life. We know that he came from a lowborn family, which could have caused it. He could have also experienced other traumas and possible neglect.

Could He Be A Sociopath?

I think it could be possible and would explain the way he is, and give deeper meaning to his actions. Personally, I think that he is.

What do you think?

So on and so forth.

I think it’s safe to say that Baelish does not feel any remorse, guilt or empathy. He doesn’t seem at all bothered when he throws Lysa or when has a child poisoned or when he marries Sansa to Ramsay (someone known for being cruel). He just doesn’t care and doesn’t feel bad about it.

“Littlefinger is willing to casually dispose of people who trusted him, like a man replacing a coat he no longer needs.”

We all know that Baelish has an obsession with winning “the game”. He wants power and he wants control. He acts as though everyone else is a chess piece in his game, using them to move spaces and get him ahead. He even says that, at one point…

“Are you a player or are you a piece?”

“Whenever I consider a question, I ask myself ‘Will this action make this picture a reality’, pull it out of my mind and into the world…and I only act if the answer is yes. A picture of me on the Iron Throne, and you by my side.”

“He would see this country burn if he could be king of the ashes.”

“Chaos isn’t a pit. Chaos is a ladder. Many who try to climb it fail, and never get to try again. The fall breaks them. And some are given a chance to climb, but refuse. They cling to the realm, or the gods, or love… illusions. Only the ladder is real. The climb is all there is.”

“Littlefinger was born with no lands, no wealth, no armies. He has acquired the first two. How long before he has the army? Perhaps you’ll laugh, but I know him better than most, and this is the truth. Littlefinger is one of the most dangerous men in Westeros.”

This next one is something I’m not entirely sure upon. Does he mimic behaviour and emotions? Possibly. We don’t see a whole lot of genuine emotion coming from him. The one time he shows some full-on “emotion”, is when he about to be executed. And even then, it feels somehow fake and artificial - he may have been crying and begging because that’s what he thought they wanted to see, and what he thought would get him out of the situation.

“He is capable of putting on a seemingly friendly face with a friendly smile - but his eyes don’t smile when his mouth does.”

And now… He’s considered a charming and likeable person, somewhat. Cat still trusts him and he uses that as an advantage to manipulate her - the woman he supposedly loves or loved, at least.

“Even Littlefinger’s alleged feelings for Catelyn Stark truly seem to have just been a rationalization for his greed for power. Though surely, Littlefinger himself is convinced that he truly "loved” her, in reality, his attraction was one-sided, and he was obsessively stalking a girl who never returned his affections beyond a platonic level.“

What Causes It?

  • Family history of the disorder.
  • Injuries to brain or abnormal brain development or how the brain functions
  • Childhood conduct disorder.
  • Trauma, abuse or neglect in childhood.
  • Low social or economic status as child.

Simply from this, I have some theories about why Baelish could be a Sociopath. We don’t know much about his childhood but we do know that he got into a fight with Brandon Stark - and almost died. He could have sustained a brain injury during that time. Besides that, it could have to do with his family and family life. We know that he came from a lowborn family, which could have caused it. He could have also experienced other traumas and possible neglect.

Could He Be A Sociopath?

I think it could be possible and would explain the way he is, and give deeper meaning to his actions. Personally, I think that he is.

What do you think?
trail.content:
Is Littlefinger A Sociopath?

Signs Of A Sociopath:

Someone with Antisocial Personality Disorder, ocurring from the age of 15 and up. Must have at least 3 of the following:

  • Failure to conform to social norms with respect to lawful/moral behaviour.
  • Deceitfulness, as indicated by lying, use of aliases and conning others.
  • Impulsivity or failure to plan ahead.
  • Irritability and aggressiveness.
  • Reckless disregard for safety of themselves and others.
  • Consistent irresponsibility.
  • Lack of remorse, guilt, shame or emotion
  • Focus on winning the “game of life”.
  • Want control over others and power.
  • Can mimic emotion and behaviour so that they get what they want.
  • Untrustworthy and constantly lies.
  • Insantly likeable or charming.

Can you spot at least 3 that match Baelish?

The Evidence:

Oh, boy, is there a lot of evidence! Let’s begin. Well, the first one is rather obvious. Baelish runs brothels and has taken part in the murders of a Hand (Arryn) and a King (Joff). He doesn’t exactly exuberate lawful and moral behaviour, nor does he respect it.

His deceitfulness is as plain as day. Baelish is renowned for his lying and manipulation, and revels in it. It’s his own personal playground. This also ties into not being able to trust him. At all. This evidenced by his actions and even himself, with that rather iconic line…

“Distrusting me was the wisest thing you’ve done since you climbed off your horse.”

“Look around you, we’re all liars here, and every one of us is better than you.”

“Is there an idiot in any village who trusts Littlefinger?”

This third one was a little tricky and I had to do some searching. And as it turns out, Baelish isn’t great at planning things. For one, that fight with Brandon Stark - impulsive, brash and planned terribly. Then we have the entire plan to cause a rift between Lannisters and Starks by making a flimsy lie about Tyrion owning the Valyrian Steel dagger. In truth, the only reason his plans “worked” is because of some luck and a dash of deceit.

“So I challenged him to a duel. I mean, why not? I’d read all the stories. The little hero always beats the big villain in all the stories. In the end, she wouldn’t even let him kill me.”

“The first mistake was when he subtly made a jab at Cersei about her unnatural relationship with her brother Jaime, that knowledge is power, which resulted in Cersei nearly having him killed before deciding to remind him of his place.”

The fourth one does not apply to Baelish. He has not shown any aggressiveness.

This next one definitely applies to him. Baelish blatantly does not care about what happens to others and, arguably, doesn’t really have much regard for himself. He doesn’t care about the safety of Sansa when he marries her to Ramsay (show) or keeps her in the Vale. He doesn’t care about Lysa when he pushes her from the Moon Door. He doesn’t care, even, about Cat (he manipulates her without any issue).

“When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it.”

The next one also somewhat suits Baelish. Sociopaths don’t take claim for their wrongdoings and are only responsible in terms of how they deem “responsibility”. Baelish is more than eager to toss the blame of the dagger onto Tyrion in order to wage war between Stark and Lannister. He is more than eager to make everyone believe that Lysa jumped herself. So on and so forth.

I think it’s safe to say that Baelish does not feel any remorse, guilt or empathy. He doesn’t seem at all bothered when he throws Lysa or when has a child poisoned or when he marries Sansa to Ramsay (someone known for being cruel). He just doesn’t care and doesn’t feel bad about it.

“Littlefinger is willing to casually dispose of people who trusted him, like a man replacing a coat he no longer needs.”

We all know that Baelish has an obsession with winning “the game”. He wants power and he wants control. He acts as though everyone else is a chess piece in his game, using them to move spaces and get him ahead. He even says that, at one point…

“Are you a player or are you a piece?”

“Whenever I consider a question, I ask myself ‘Will this action make this picture a reality’, pull it out of my mind and into the world…and I only act if the answer is yes. A picture of me on the Iron Throne, and you by my side.”

“He would see this country burn if he could be king of the ashes.”

“Chaos isn’t a pit. Chaos is a ladder. Many who try to climb it fail, and never get to try again. The fall breaks them. And some are given a chance to climb, but refuse. They cling to the realm, or the gods, or love… illusions. Only the ladder is real. The climb is all there is.”

“Littlefinger was born with no lands, no wealth, no armies. He has acquired the first two. How long before he has the army? Perhaps you’ll laugh, but I know him better than most, and this is the truth. Littlefinger is one of the most dangerous men in Westeros.”

This next one is something I’m not entirely sure upon. Does he mimic behaviour and emotions? Possibly. We don’t see a whole lot of genuine emotion coming from him. The one time he shows some full-on “emotion”, is when he about to be executed. And even then, it feels somehow fake and artificial - he may have been crying and begging because that’s what he thought they wanted to see, and what he thought would get him out of the situation.

“He is capable of putting on a seemingly friendly face with a friendly smile - but his eyes don’t smile when his mouth does.”

And now… He’s considered a charming and likeable person, somewhat. Cat still trusts him and he uses that as an advantage to manipulate her - the woman he supposedly loves or loved, at least.

“Even Littlefinger’s alleged feelings for Catelyn Stark truly seem to have just been a rationalization for his greed for power. Though surely, Littlefinger himself is convinced that he truly "loved” her, in reality, his attraction was one-sided, and he was obsessively stalking a girl who never returned his affections beyond a platonic level.“

What Causes It?

  • Family history of the disorder.
  • Injuries to brain or abnormal brain development or how the brain functions
  • Childhood conduct disorder.
  • Trauma, abuse or neglect in childhood.
  • Low social or economic status as child.

Simply from this, I have some theories about why Baelish could be a Sociopath. We don’t know much about his childhood but we do know that he got into a fight with Brandon Stark - and almost died. He could have sustained a brain injury during that time. Besides that, it could have to do with his family and family life. We know that he came from a lowborn family, which could have caused it. He could have also experienced other traumas and possible neglect.

Could He Be A Sociopath?

I think it could be possible and would explain the way he is, and give deeper meaning to his actions. Personally, I think that he is.

What do you think?

title:
Chapter 8 | Honeycrisp Apples 
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
The days were long, but Sansa was surprised at how quickly they went. It helped that each day she had some form of surprise waiting for her. Monday was her smoothie; then on Tuesday it was a bouquet of flowers that were delivered to her apartment. Sansa told her roommates they were from her parents, even as the card read,

Keep smiling, my little bird.

She kept the card tucked into the edge of her mirror.

Wednesday was her second busiest day of the week, and she went nearly the whole day without anything from Sandor. She was just thinking that he’d forgotten, or that she was selfish for assuming he’d do something every day, when a Jimmy John’s delivery man walked into the library where she was studying, holding a sandwich and chips.

“Sansa?” he called and she rose, surprised. He handed her the bag and left. She sank down, and looked at her phone. She had a text from Sandor.

Told you I’d get you back for the pasta.
